TITLE: From increases in minimum wage to recreational marijuana, these new laws take effect in 2023
SUMMARY: As President Joe Biden scored several legislative wins this year, voters across the country headed to the polls in November to decide on local measures.

TITLE: A pregnant mom crossed the Rio Grande decades ago to give her unborn child a better life. Now her daughter is becoming a member of Congress
SUMMARY: Delia Ramirez of Illinois, whose mother carried her in her womb to the US from Guatemala, is about to become the first Latina congresswoman from the Midwest. Her husband is a DACA recipient who cannot vote and faces risk of deportation.

TITLE: Biden will promote infrastructure law with McConnell in Kentucky this week as he seeks bipartisanship in new Congress
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden will join top Republican officials to herald the bipartisan infrastructure law this week as the GOP assumes control of the US House of Representatives.

TITLE: Kinzinger: I 'fear for the future of this country' if Trump isn't charged over Jan. 6
SUMMARY: Outgoing Republican Rep. Adam Kinzinger said Sunday he fears for the future of the country if former President Donald Trump isn't charged with a crime related to the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol, though he believes the Justice Department will "do the right thing."

TITLE: 'Have you heard I was 83?': Hoyer on stepping back from House leadership
SUMMARY: The top three House Democrats who are stepping back from their leadership spots did not coordinate on their decisions to do so, outgoing Majority Leader Steny Hoyer said Sunday, adding that "the timing was right."

TITLE: Wes Moore reflects on historic election as Maryland's first Black governor
SUMMARY: Wes Moore, the incoming governor of Maryland, reflected Sunday on the historic nature of his election as the state's first Black chief executive. "It is remarkable," the Democrat said in an interview on CNN's "State of the Union" with Dana Bash.

TITLE: Biden will promote bipartisanship as he returns to a changed Washington
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden, after returning this week to a politically reshaped Washington, will join top Republican officials to herald his infrastructure law as he seeks out bipartisan cooperation in a new era of divided government.

TITLE: McCarthy commits to key concession in call with frustrated House Republicans
SUMMARY: House GOP leader Kevin McCarthy outlined some of the concessions that he has agreed to in his campaign for speaker on a Sunday evening conference call -- including making it easier to topple the speaker, according to multiple GOP sources on the call. But McCarthy could not say whether he would have the votes for the speakership, even after giving in to some of the right's most hardline demands.

TITLE: How Josh Shapiro rode his record as Pennsylvania attorney general to the governor's mansion
SUMMARY: Josh Shapiro had a massive spending advantage and a weak Republican opponent, but the incoming Pennsylvania governor thinks Democrats should still take note of how he made voters see his fight-for-the-little-guy speeches as more than just talk -- and racked up the party's biggest margin in any swing-state race of 2022.

TITLE: Kevin McCarthy's problem: historically unpopular with a historically small majority
SUMMARY: House Republican leader Kevin McCarthy is hoping all's well that ends well when it comes to becoming speaker of the chamber. The current minority leader and former majority leader may have thought he'd have the speakership locked up by now, but, ahead of the new Congress that begins on Tuesday, he doesn't.

TITLE: Highlights from the latest release of January 6 transcripts
SUMMARY: The House January 6 committee on Sunday released another wave of witness interview transcripts.

TITLE: Five political trends that could make 2023 a momentous year
SUMMARY: Republicans' take over of the House this week will usher in a two-year political era that threatens to bring governing showdowns and shutdowns as a GOP speaker and Democratic president try to wield power from opposite ends of Pennsylvania Avenue.

TITLE: Inside McCarthy's struggle to lock down the House speakership
SUMMARY: Time is running out for Kevin McCarthy.

TITLE: Whitmer urges both parties to 'stand up' to violent rhetoric and threats as she embarks on second term
SUMMARY: Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, sworn in for a second term Sunday, called the sentencing last week of two men convicted of plotting to kidnap her "just," while urging both parties to confront threats and violent rhetoric.

TITLE: What you need to know about the House speaker election
SUMMARY: Rep. Kevin McCarthy has a math problem, and he has to solve it by January 3. When the new Congress assembles on that date, it establishes a quorum, and then its first action will be a roll call vote to elect a new speaker. Not until after this election does the House get down to business.

Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer sits down with CNN's Kaitlan Collins to discuss her plans for her second term as governor and says the sentencing of two men convicted of plotting to kidnap her was "just," while urging both parties to confront threats and violent rhetoric.

TITLE: Trump White House aides respond to January 6 in angry text exchange
SUMMARY: A text exchange between Ivanka Trump's chief of staff Julie Radford and White House aide Hope Hicks reveals their anger over then-President Donald Trump's actions on January 6, 2021, hurting them professionally, according to newly released documents collected by the House select committee investigating the Capitol Hill insurrection.

TITLE: GOP dilemma: If not McCarthy, then who?
SUMMARY: As House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy has struggled to lock down the votes to become speaker, his top deputy has kept his head down.

TITLE: A record number of women will serve in the next Congress
SUMMARY: The 149 women who will serve in the 118th Congress will expand the ranks of female representation by just two members. There will be a record number of Black and Latina women in the House, as well as a record number of Republican women.

TITLE: The history-makers of the 118th Congress
SUMMARY: The 118th Congress, being sworn in Tuesday, will eclipse several records set by the outgoing Congress.

TITLE: January 6 committee warns White House it can't ensure identity of anonymous witnesses will remain protected
SUMMARY: The House January 6 committee has warned President Joe Biden's White House that it cannot ensure that the identity of personnel who cooperated with its probe on the condition of anonymity will remain protected once the panel dissolves on Tuesday.

TITLE: New York Times: Brazilian authorities intend to revive fraud case against George Santos
SUMMARY: Law enforcement officials in Brazil will likely reinstate fraud charges against US Rep.-elect George Santos as the New York Republican officially assumes his role in the US House Tuesday under a cloud of suspicion over his dubious resume, the New York Times reported Monday.

TITLE: Why the right has already won the House speakership election
SUMMARY: No matter how they resolve Tuesday's vote choosing the next speaker of the House,  Republicans appear poised to double down on the hard-edged politics that most swing state voters rejected in last November's midterm election.

TITLE: McCarthy's bet on Trump yet to pay off as he scrambles for speaker's gavel
SUMMARY: Being "My Kevin" isn't counting for much yet.

TITLE: McCarthy faces make-or-break moment in vote to elect House speaker
SUMMARY: House GOP leader Kevin McCarthy faces a make-or-break moment on Tuesday, as he seeks to lock down the support necessary to become the next speaker in a vote that could turn into a chaotic and contentious once-in-a-century floor fight.

TITLE: Florida Gov. DeSantis begins second term with spotlight on presidential ambitions
SUMMARY: When Ron DeSantis takes the oath of office on the steps of the Historic Capitol at noon on Tuesday, far more will be looming than his second term as Florida governor. His speech, along with his agenda, will be seen through the prism of a potential 2024 GOP presidential bid.

TITLE: George Santos set to be sworn in to Congress amid mounting scrutiny and condemnation
SUMMARY: Congressman-elect George Santos of New York is scheduled to be sworn in to Congress on Tuesday as he faces mounting scrutiny and condemnation over lies about his biography and amid an investigation by federal prosecutors into his finances.

TITLE: For freshman members of Congress, January 3 feels a bit like first day of school
SUMMARY: The 118th Congress will officially get underway Tuesday -- and for freshman lawmakers, the transition can feel a bit like the first day of school.

TITLE: Andy Biggs: Meet the longshot conservative challenger for speaker
SUMMARY: As Republicans gear up to take control of the House, GOP leader Kevin McCarthy is facing a longshot challenge in the race for speaker from hard-right Arizona Republican Rep. Andy Biggs.

TITLE: No. 2 House Republican on GOP's radar as party gears up for speakership fight
SUMMARY: All eyes are on a number of top House Republicans, including Louisiana Rep. Steve Scalise, as the GOP braces for a Tuesday speakership vote that could devolve into a drawn-out floor fight not seen in a century.

TITLE: The latest on the new Congress and House speaker vote
SUMMARY: The newly elected 118th Congress will officially be sworn in on Jan. 3 and the House speaker election will be held. Follow here for the latest live news updates from Capitol Hill.

TITLE: Brazilian authorities intend to revive fraud case against George Santos
SUMMARY: Law enforcement officials in Brazil will reinstate fraud charges against Rep.-elect George Santos, the Rio de Janeiro prosecutor's office tells CNN, as the New York Republican officially assumes his role in the US House Tuesday under a cloud of suspicion over his dubious resume.

TITLE: The right has already won the House speakership election
SUMMARY: No matter how they resolve Tuesday's vote choosing the next speaker of the House, Republicans appear poised to double down on the hard-edged politics that most swing state voters rejected in last November's midterm election.

TITLE: House confronts once-in-a-century fight to elect speaker as McCarthy fails to lock down votes
SUMMARY: The new House Republican majority faces a once-in-a-century fight to elect the next speaker after GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failed to lock down the votes needed to win in the first round of voting. The chamber is voting on a second ballot, something that hasn't happened since 1923.

TITLE: Two charged with attacks on four power substations in Washington state
SUMMARY: Two men were arrested on New Year's Eve for allegedly shutting down four Washington state power substations in late December that led to power outages for thousands across Pierce County.

TITLE: Big questions on student loan forgiveness loom in 2023
SUMMARY: Student loan borrowers are starting 2023 with a lot of uncertainty. The mired rollout of President Joe Biden's forgiveness program has created confusion for borrowers. Here are some of the big questions surrounding student loans this year.

TITLE: Jim Jordan nominated for speaker by conservative hardliners amid GOP infighting for House leadership
SUMMARY: Conservative hardliners nominated Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio on Tuesday to be speaker of the House during the chamber's second and third votes amid the floor fight for House leadership.

TITLE: January 6 committee warns White House it can't ensure identity of anonymous witnesses will remain protected
SUMMARY: The House January 6 committee has warned President Joe Biden's White House that it cannot ensure that the identity of personnel who cooperated with its probe on the condition of anonymity will remain protected once the panel dissolves on Tuesday.

TITLE: McCarthy fails to lock down votes on second ballot amid once-in-a-century speaker fight
SUMMARY: The new House Republican majority is locked in a once-in-a-century fight to elect the next speaker after GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the support needed to win in two rounds of voting on Tuesday. The chamber is now engaged in a third round of voting as McCarthy continues his increasingly imperiled bid for speaker.

TITLE: House adjourns without electing a speaker as McCarthy fails to lock down votes
SUMMARY: The new House GOP majority is locked in a chaotic once-in-a-century fight to determine who will serve as the next speaker after Republican Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary support to win in three rounds of voting on Tuesday. The House is now adjourned until Wednesday at noon as Republicans scramble to find a path forward.

TITLE: Supreme Court asked to step in on New York concealed carry firearm law
SUMMARY: New York Attorney General Letitia James asked the Supreme Court on Tuesday to allow a new state law that places restrictions on carrying a concealed firearm to stay in effect while legal challenges play out.

TITLE: US had 'direct conversations' with Russia on Paul Whelan since Griner's release, State Department says
SUMMARY: US officials "have had direct conversations with Russian officials regarding Paul Whelan," an American wrongfully detained in Russia, since the release of fellow wrongfully detained American Brittney Griner, State Department spokesperson Ned Price said Tuesday.

TITLE: Here are the 20 House Republicans who voted against McCarthy for speaker on the third ballot
SUMMARY: Republican leader Kevin McCarthy suffered a third rebuke for speaker before the House adjourned Tuesday evening.

TITLE: This Capitol drama is turning into a horror show
SUMMARY: There's a slow motion, open-ended drama playing on the floor of the House in which Republicans cannot come behind a speaker -- one of the most powerful and important jobs in US government.

TITLE: January 3, 2023 Latest on the new Congress and House speaker vote
SUMMARY: GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failed to secure enough support to win the speakership after a third round of voting -- and lawmakers decided to postpone future votes until Wednesday.

TITLE: FDA to allow pharmacies to dispense abortion pills to patients
SUMMARY: The US Food and Drug Administration is allowing certified pharmacies to dispense the abortion medication mifepristone to people who have a prescription.

TITLE: With farcical speaker deadlock, the new Republican House brings chaos back to Washington
SUMMARY: Governing by chaos is back.

TITLE: What happens in the House when there is no speaker? Not a lot
SUMMARY: House Republicans' failure to elect a speaker on Tuesday after multiple rounds of voting isn't just denying the GOP a leader -- it's holding up much of the functioning of the chamber.

SUMMARY: Republican Rep.-elect George Santos admitted to stealing a man's checkbook that was in his mother's possession to purchase clothing and shoes in 2008, according to documents obtained by CNN.

SUMMARY: House Republicans are at a contentious stalemate over who will serve as the next speaker as Kevin McCarthy vows to continue his increasingly imperiled bid for the gavel. The fight, which began on the first day of the 118th Congress, has thrown the new House GOP majority into chaos and undercut the party's agenda.

SUMMARY: Parts made by more than a dozen US and Western companies were found inside a single Iranian drone downed in Ukraine last fall, according to a Ukrainian intelligence assessment obtained exclusively by CNN.

SUMMARY: Rep. Hakeem Jeffries is expected to make history as the first Black lawmaker to lead a party in Congress as the 118th Congress convenes in Washington.

SUMMARY: The FBI is now offering $500,000 for information leading to an arrest of the person who placed pipe bombs near the Republican National Committee and Democratic National Committee headquarters in Washington, DC, the night before the 2021 US Capitol riot, the bureau announced Wednesday.

SUMMARY: Parts made by more than a dozen US and Western companies were found inside a single Iranian drone downed in Ukraine last fall, according to a Ukrainian intelligence assessment obtained exclusively by CNN.

SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy suffered yet another stinging defeat on Wednesday as he lost in the fifth round of voting to elect a speaker -- a major blow that increasingly imperils his bid for speaker and heightens uncertainty over whether he can still secure the gavel or if a viable candidate will emerge as an alternative.

SUMMARY: President Joe Biden said on Wednesday he intends to visit to US-Mexico border when he travels next week to the North American Leaders' Summit in Mexico City.

SUMMARY: A rare scene unfolded Wednesday in Covington, Kentucky: President Joe Biden stood alongside Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, as the two men promoted a major bipartisan legislative accomplishment they achieved together.

SUMMARY: Just over a quarter of US service members have experienced food insecurity in recent years, according to a new report from the RAND Corporation.

SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy suffered yet another stinging defeat on Wednesday as he lost in the sixth round of voting to elect a speaker -- a major blow that increasingly imperils his bid and heightens uncertainty over whether he can still secure the gavel or if a viable candidate will emerge as an alternative.

TITLE: Brazilian clerk allegedly defrauded by George Santos calls him 'a professional liar'
SUMMARY: A Brazilian former shop clerk allegedly defrauded out of more than $1,300 by George Santos has a message to voters who cast ballots for the Republican congressman-elect: "Don't feel guilty, he does that really well. He's a professional liar."

TITLE: Byron Donalds: Who is the hard-right's new nominee for speaker?
SUMMARY: The far-right of the House Republican Party nominated Rep. Byron Donalds from Florida for speaker as the floor fight over the gavel continued Wednesday.

TITLE: What do these hardliners want? Here's what they've said
SUMMARY: It's a very small minority of a slim majority that's kept Congress from convening and is on the cusp of derailing Rep. Kevin McCarthy's bid to become House speaker. Here are some of the stated reasons and accepted motivations of why these lawmakers are unwilling to support McCarthy.

TITLE: Jill Biden to undergo procedure for skin lesion
SUMMARY: First lady Jill Biden will undergo a procedure next week to remove a lesion that was found during a routine skin cancer screening, her press secretary Vanessa Valdivia told CNN on Wednesday.

TITLE: Special counsel Jack Smith gets trove of new documents from local election officials
SUMMARY: Special counsel Jack Smith has received a trove of new documents from local election officials in Wisconsin and Nevada who were subpoenaed as part of the ongoing criminal investigation by the Justice Department into efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

SUMMARY: President Joe Biden said on Wednesday he intends to visit the US-Mexico border when he travels next week to the North American Leaders' Summit in Mexico City.

SUMMARY: House Republicans' failure to elect a speaker on Wednesday after two ballots and days of voting isn't just denying the GOP a leader -- it's holding up much of the functioning of the chamber.

TITLE: FBI increases reward for information on pipe bombs found near RNC and DNC headquarters to $500,000
SUMMARY: The FBI, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives and the Washington, DC, Metropolitan Police Department are now offering $500,000 for information leading to an arrest of the person who placed pipe bombs near the Republican National Committee and Democratic National Committee headquarters in Washington, DC, the night before the 2021 US Capitol riot, the FBI announced Wednesday.

TITLE: First on CNN: McCarthy proposes key concessions after House adjourns for second day without electing a speaker
SUMMARY: After suffering yet another stinging defeat on Wednesday, in which he lost a sixth round of voting for House speaker, Kevin McCarthy proposed more key concessions in his push to get 218 votes  -- including agreeing to propose a rules change that would allow just one member to call for a vote to oust a sitting speaker, according to two sources familiar with the matter.

TITLE: McCarthy takes desperation for speakership to new level
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy is so desperate to be speaker, he's ready to gut his own power just to get the job.

TITLE: Republicans scramble to end impasse over McCarthy's imperiled speakership bid
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy faces growing pressure to end the impasse over his imperiled speakership bid after two consecutive days of failed votes. But even after proposing major concessions to his hardline opponents late Wednesday, it remains unclear if the California Republican will be able to lock in the support he needs to win the gavel, and patience is wearing thin among lawmakers as the fight drags on.

TITLE: What do these hardliners want? Here's what they've said
SUMMARY: It's a very small minority of a slim majority that's kept Congress from convening and is on the cusp of derailing Rep. Kevin McCarthy's bid to become House speaker. Here are some of the stated reasons and accepted motivations of why these lawmakers are unwilling to support McCarthy.

TITLE: Speaker of the House vote and news
SUMMARY: The House is still in a holding pattern after lawmakers failed to elect a new speaker for the second day. Follow for the latest live news updates.

TITLE: The lack of a new speaker has ground House business to a halt
SUMMARY: House Republicans' failure to elect a speaker after days of voting has frozen business in the chamber -- and some GOP members are now warning that the impasse has implications on national security-related briefings and oversight.

TITLE: Michigan Sen. Debbie Stabenow won't seek reelection in 2024
SUMMARY: Sen. Debbie Stabenow will not seek reelection in 2024, the longtime Michigan Democrat said Thursday.

TITLE: Here's where Americans will pay less in state taxes in 2023
SUMMARY: States are kicking off 2023 with a bevy of tax changes for their residents and businesses. Some 38 states had noteworthy alterations -- mostly net tax reductions -- take effect on January 1.

TITLE: Biden to announce new migration programs as he prepares to visit the border on Sunday
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden will announce Thursday he is expanding a program to accept up to 30,000 migrants per month from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela -- along with a plan to expel as many migrants from those countries who circumvent US laws -- as his administration confronts a surge of migrants at the southern border.

TITLE: First on CNN: Biden to honor 12 people with Presidential Citizens Medal on two-year anniversary of January 6 insurrection
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday plans to mark the two-year anniversary of the January 6, 2021, insurrection by awarding for the first time in his presidency the Presidential Citizens Medal to 12 people.

TITLE: The clerk presiding during the speaker vote is no stranger to turbulent times in the House
SUMMARY: Cheryl Johnson, the House clerk who has presided over the contentious votes taking place this week during the speakership elections, is no stranger to turbulent times in the House of Representatives.

TITLE: Biden announces new migration programs as he prepares to visit the border on Sunday
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Thursday announced he is expanding a program to accept up to 30,000 migrants per month from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela -- along with a plan to expel as many migrants from those countries who circumvent US laws -- as his administration confronts a surge of migrants at the southern border.

TITLE: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson set to publish 'Lovely One' memoir
SUMMARY: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson is planning to release a memoir on her life titled "Lovely One," the book's publisher announced Thursday.

TITLE: Pennsylvania Sen. Bob Casey announces prostate cancer diagnosis
SUMMARY: Pennsylvania Sen. Bob Casey said Thursday he has been diagnosed with prostate cancer and has an "excellent prognosis."

TITLE: Democratic senators say Navy response to suicides on board aircraft carrier is unacceptable
SUMMARY: The Navy's response to a series of suicides on board a US aircraft carrier was unacceptable, according to two Democratic senators, who called on Navy leadership to improve the living conditions for sailors working in shipyards and provide better mental health care.

TITLE: South Carolina's six-week abortion ban struck down by state Supreme Court
SUMMARY: The South Carolina state Supreme Court ruled Thursday that the state's six-week ban on abortion violates the state's constitution.

TITLE: House to take seventh vote for speaker as McCarthy struggles to lock down votes
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy faces growing pressure to end the impasse over his imperiled speakership bid after two consecutive days of failed votes. Even after proposing major concessions to his hardline conservative opponents late Wednesday, it remains unclear if the California Republican will be able to lock in the 218 votes he needs to win the gavel.

TITLE: How the speaker impasse is impacting US national security
SUMMARY: The House's inability to select a speaker is impacting US national security, Republican and Democratic lawmakers and staffers say, as members who can't yet be sworn in are being locked out of classified briefings and the Biden administration is effectively operating without House oversight.

TITLE: McCarthy loses seventh vote for speaker as he struggles to lock down votes
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy came up short once again on Thursday as he lost the seventh House vote to elect a new speaker. The outcome will only increase pressure on McCarthy to end the impasse over his imperiled speakership bid, but it is unclear whether he will be able to pull it off as the situation grows increasingly dire for his future political prospects. The House is moving to hold an eighth vote.

TITLE: Capitol Police ramp up security ahead of protests planned on two-year anniversary of January 6 insurrection
SUMMARY: The US Capitol Police is ramping up its security posture and monitoring online chatter about planned protests set to occur on Friday's two-year anniversary of the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol.

TITLE: Pennsylvania Gov.-elect Shapiro taps Republican targeted by Trump for top state elections job
SUMMARY: Democrat Josh Shapiro, the incoming Pennsylvania governor, announced Thursday that he has selected Republican Al Schmidt, a leading opponent of former President Donald Trump's efforts to disrupt the counting of votes in 2020, to become secretary of the commonwealth, the state's top elections official.

TITLE: US to send Bradley vehicles to Ukraine as part of new aid package
SUMMARY: The United States will supply Ukraine with Bradley fighting vehicles as part of a new security assistance package to the country as it nears the one-year anniversary of Russia's invasion.

TITLE: First on CNN: Biden to honor 12 people with Presidential Citizens Medal on two-year anniversary of January 6 insurrection
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday plans to mark the two-year anniversary of the January 6, 2021, insurrection by awarding for the first time in his presidency the Presidential Citizens Medal to 12 people.

TITLE: McCarthy loses eighth vote for speaker as he struggles to lock down votes
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy came up short once again on Thursday as he lost the eighth House vote to elect a new speaker. Each failed vote only increases pressure on McCarthy to end the impasse, but it is unclear whether he will be able to pull it off as the situation grows increasingly dire for his future political prospects. The House is now moving to hold a ninth vote -- the number of ballots needed to elect a speaker in 1923, the last time multiple ballots took place.

TITLE: McCarthy loses ninth vote as his speaker bid faces increasingly dire prospects
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy came up short once again on Thursday as he lost the ninth House vote to elect a new House speaker -- the same number of voting rounds needed in 1923, which is the last time multiple ballots took place for the speakership.

TITLE: McCarthy's stumbles reveal Trump's diminished influence over GOP
SUMMARY: In the weeks since former President Donald Trump launched his third presidential campaign, few political moments have underscored his diminished standing inside the Republican Party as the ongoing stalemate over Rep. Kevin McCarthy's bid to be House speaker.

TITLE: Biden announces new migration programs as he prepares to visit the border on Sunday
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Thursday announced he is expanding a program to accept up to 30,000 migrants per month from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela -- along with a plan to expel as many migrants from those countries who circumvent US laws -- as his administration confronts a surge of migrants at the southern border.

TITLE: US military expands leave for new parents in uniform
SUMMARY: The US military introduced new rights on Wednesday for military parents, doubling the amount of leave time for service members who give birth and providing leave for new parents who don't give birth, including those who adopt and foster long-term.

TITLE: The Biden administration keeps shifting its stance on a controversial policy
SUMMARY: Over the past two years, the Biden administration has sent mixed messages about where it stands on the Title 42 border policy. Thursday was just the latest example. Here's a quick look at how the administration's stance has shifted.

TITLE: The most obvious speaker solution is also the most radical
SUMMARY: It's the easiest, most elegant and simple solution to Rep. Kevin McCarthy's failure to bring Republicans together. Just find a few Democrats already. Form a coalition. Edge out these hard-line Republicans and get the House to work.

TITLE: McCarthy loses tenth vote in longest speaker contest in 164 years
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy came up short once again on Thursday as he lost the tenth House vote to elect a new speaker, making this the longest speaker contest in 164 years.

TITLE: Trump lawyers ordered to hand over names of individuals hired to search Trump properties for classified documents
SUMMARY: A federal judge has asked former President Donald Trump's attorneys to turn over the names of the individuals hired to search four properties for documents late last year, a source familiar with the order told CNN.

TITLE: House adjourns for third day without picking a speaker in longest contest in 164 years
SUMMARY: The House has adjourned for the third day without electing a new speaker after Kevin McCarthy continued to suffer a string of defeats in multiple rounds of voting on Thursday. As the fight for the gavel drags on, it has now become the longest speaker contest in 164 years.

TITLE: Trump accused in lawsuit of causing wrongful death of Officer Brian Sicknick in US Capitol attack
SUMMARY: The estate of Brian Sicknick, a Capitol Police officer who died after responding to the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol, is suing two rioters involved in the attack and former President Donald Trump for his alleged role in egging it on.

SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy is the latest Republican leader to find out that it's impossible to get ahead of his party's inexorable march to its far-right extremes.

SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy is locked in a fight for his political future as the California Republican attempts to win the votes he needs to become speaker of the US House of Representatives in what has now become the longest contest in 164 years.

TITLE: Two years after US Capitol attack, investigation into Trump and insurrection enters new phase
SUMMARY: Two years after rioters stormed the US Capitol, the Justice Department's sprawling criminal investigation into the effort to block the peaceful transition of power enters a new phase with the special counsel adding two right-hand prosecutors to an experienced team that will ultimately determine whether former President Donald Trump or his allies should face prosecution.

SUMMARY: The House speaker stalemate continues after GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary support in the multiple rounds of voting. Follow for the latest live news updates.

TITLE: Democratic senators say Navy response to suicides on board aircraft carrier is unacceptable
SUMMARY: The Navy's response to a series of suicides on board a US aircraft carrier was unacceptable, according to two Democratic senators, who called on Navy leadership to improve the living conditions for sailors working in shipyards and provide better mental health care.

TITLE: Biden to honor January 6 democracy defenders in capstone to a split-screen week
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday will commemorate the January 6, 2021, insurrection at the US Capitol -- the day he's called "one of the darkest periods of our nation's history" -- as he seeks to elevate the law enforcement and election officials that held firm against the most serious effort to prevent the peaceful transfer of power in US history.

TITLE: US imposes sanctions on Iranian officials connected to drone program
SUMMARY: The US Treasury on Friday imposed sanctions on officials tied to an Iranian defense manufacturer that designs and produces drones which have been used by Russia in the war in Ukraine, as well as the director of "the key organization responsible for overseeing Iran's ballistic missile programs."

TITLE: Judge suspends law license of lawyer for Alex Jones following Sandy Hook document leaks
SUMMARY: A Connecticut judge suspended the law license of a lawyer for right-wing conspiracy theorist Alex Jones after he allegedly improperly released court documents from the Sandy Hook defamation case.

TITLE: SEC closes insider trading probe into former Republican senator
SUMMARY: The US Securities and Exchange Commission has closed its insider trading investigation into stock trades made by then-Sen. Richard Burr and his brother-in-law at the outset of the pandemic, the former senator announced Friday.

TITLE: House to hold 12th vote in longest speaker contest in 164 years
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy is locked in a fight for his political future as the California Republican attempts to win the votes he needs to become speaker of the US House of Representatives in what has now become the longest contest in 164 years. The House is now moving to hold a 12th vote with no end in sight as of yet.

TITLE: DNC officials recommend giving New Hampshire and Georgia extra time to meet requirements under proposed 2024 calendar
SUMMARY: The co-chairs of the Democratic Party's rule-making arm are recommending that New Hampshire and Georgia be given extra time to take steps toward changing their presidential primary dates.

TITLE: McCarthy flips 14 votes as he fights for the speaker's gavel
SUMMARY: In a dramatic shift, Kevin McCarthy managed to flip 14 votes in his favor during the 12th round of voting to elect a new House Speaker, though the California Republican is still short of the support he needs to win and it is unclear whether he will be able to get there.

TITLE: The latest on the House speaker vote
SUMMARY: The House speaker stalemate continues after GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary support in the multiple rounds of voting. Follow for the latest live news updates.

TITLE: Federal Election Commission flags issues with contributions to Santos campaign
SUMMARY: The Federal Election Commission has flagged issues with contributions made to embattled Rep.-elect George Santos' campaign, according to a letter addressed to the New York Republican's fundraising committee this week.

TITLE: Biden honors January 6 democracy defenders in capstone to a split-screen week: 'History will remember your names'
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday commemorated two years since the January 6, 2021, insurrection at the US Capitol -- the day he's called "one of the darkest periods of our nation's history" -- as he seeks to elevate the law enforcement and election officials that held firm against the most serious effort to prevent the peaceful transfer of power in American history.

TITLE: McCarthy flips 15 votes as he fights for the speaker's gavel
SUMMARY: In a dramatic shift, Kevin McCarthy has so far managed to flip 15 votes on Friday in his bid to become the next House speaker, though the California Republican is still short of the support needed to win and it is unclear whether he will be able to get there. The House has voted to adjourn until 10 p.m. ET.

TITLE: What do these hardliners want? Here's what they've said
SUMMARY: It's a very small minority of a slim majority that's kept Congress from convening and is on the cusp of derailing Rep. Kevin McCarthy's bid to become House speaker. Here are some of the stated reasons and accepted motivations of why these lawmakers are unwilling to support McCarthy.

TITLE: Michigan attorney general re-opens criminal probe into fake electors for Trump
SUMMARY: Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel has re-opened her criminal investigation into fake electors who signed a certificate claiming former President Donald Trump won the state in the 2020 election when he did not, she said on Friday.

TITLE: Biden honors January 6 democracy defenders: 'History will remember your names'
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday commemorated two years since the January 6, 2021, insurrection at the US Capitol -- a day he's called "one of the darkest periods of our nation's history" -- seeking to elevate the law enforcement and election officials who held firm against the most serious effort to prevent the peaceful transfer of power in American history.

TITLE: New York judge denies motion from Trump and family to dismiss $250 million lawsuit
SUMMARY: A New York state judge on Friday denied motions from former President Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump and Ivanka Trump to dismiss the New York attorney general's $250 million lawsuit, finding some of the arguments "frivolous."

TITLE: American aid to Ukraine ramps up but House GOP drama causes worry over future military help
January 6 rioter who helped kick open door to Capitol sentenced to nearly 4 years
SUMMARY: On the second anniversary of the January 6, 2021, riot, one of the first rioters to enter the US Capitol that day was sentenced to 46 months behind bars.

TITLE: Venezuelan embassy run by opposition in US closes after Guaido ouster
SUMMARY: The Venezuelan embassy in Washington, DC, that was run by the opposition has suspended its operations, it announced in a press release Friday, following Juan Guaid√≥'s ouster as opposition leader.

TITLE: The latest on the House speaker vote
SUMMARY: The House speaker stalemate continues after GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary support in the multiple rounds of voting. Follow for the latest live news updates.

TITLE: Federal appeals court strikes down ban on bump stocks
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court on Friday struck down a ban on bump stocks, devices that essentially allow shooters to fire semiautomatic rifles continuously with one pull of the trigger.

TITLE: McCarthy hopes to secure gavel after days of negotiations and failed votes
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy may be on the verge of becoming the next House speaker Friday evening, after he managed to flip 15 votes in his favor following days of failed attempts to secure the gavel -- though for now he is still short of the support he needs to win.

TITLE: McCarthy loses 14th speaker vote after days of negotiations and failed votes
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy came up short again in the 14th ballot for House speaker, a blow to the California Republican following days of painstaking negotiations and failed votes.

TITLE: Rep. Kevin McCarthy wins House speakership
SUMMARY: The House speaker stalemate finally came to a dramatic conclusion early Saturday morning, with Rep. Kevin McCarthy securing the position after 15 rounds of voting. Follow for the latest live news updates.

TITLE: McCarthy elected House speaker after days of painstaking negotiations and failed votes
SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy was elected House speaker in the early hours of Saturday morning -- a major victory for the California Republican that elevates him to a powerful position leading the GOP majority in the chamber and an outcome that followed days of painstaking negotiations and failed votes.

TITLE: Jeffries makes history as first Black lawmaker to lead a party in Congress
SUMMARY: Rep. Hakeem Jeffries made history as the first Black lawmaker to lead a party in Congress as the 118th Congress convened in Washington.

TITLE: The House has a speaker. Here's what comes next
SUMMARY: Now that a House speaker has been selected following a dayslong stalemate and members have finally been sworn in, the chamber can look toward picking back up business and organizing GOP-led committees.

TITLE: Ohio's Marcy Kaptur becomes the longest-serving woman in Congress
SUMMARY: Rep. Marcy Kaptur becomes the longest-serving woman in Congress this week after winning her first competitive race in decades. But she sees her work in Washington as far from over.

TITLE: How McCarthy survived the House chaos to win the speaker's gavel
SUMMARY: Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz strode into House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy's office on Monday night with a list of demands. Among them: The chairmanship of a key House Armed Services subcommittee.

TITLE: McCarthy elected House speaker
SUMMARY: GOP Rep. Kevin McCarthy clinched the House speakership in a dramatic 15th round of voting in the early hours of Saturday morning. Follow for live news updates.

TITLE: How an American hero 'lit his legacy on fire'
SUMMARY: CNN political analyst John Avlon, who was Rudy Giuliani's chief speech writer during his second term as mayor, including on 9/11, and later worked for Giuliani's presidential campaign, shares his thoughts on the evolution of his former boss.

SUMMARY: Kevin McCarthy was elected House speaker in the early hours of Saturday morning -- a major victory for the California Republican that elevates him to a powerful position leading the GOP majority in the chamber and an outcome that followed days of painstaking negotiations and failed votes.
